snippet: Dwyane Wade, who figured the Knicks’ focus on LeBron James would leave openings for him, scored 25 points for the Heat.
abstract: Miami Heat guard Dwyane Wade, who figured that New York Knicks focus on Heat forward LeBron James would leave openings for him, scores 25 points in Game 2 victory over New York. Photo (M)
lead_paragraph: MIAMI -- With all eyes on LeBron James, Miami Heat shooting guard Dwyane Wade knew he would have his chances in Game 2 on Monday night against the Knicks. He took advantage to set the tone in the Heat's 104-94 win, and he hopes for the rest of the series.
